The problem is that the constraint component containing JButton is not a copied
object, so this fails with an NPE:

		if(constraintComponent != null){
			EObject copiedConstraintComponent = (EObject) copier.get(constraintComponent);
			if ()
		
removeReferenceTo(copiedConstraintComponent,"constraint",constraintComponent);
//$NON-NLS-1$
		}

N20050607 build

currently happens in all Swing Layouts for all components.

Thanks for finding this - The problem is that I was trying to orphan the
constraint from the control but it's a back reference anyway so I can't see how
it was ever copied as the references explored from the JButton down should never
have dragged the ConstraintComponent into the copy set (as it's not a reference
from the JButton) so why on earth was I trying to remove the copied constraint
component from the copy set ?  I have fixed it so it doesn't care about
constraint components but I will do more testing as to why I ever tried to
remove it from the copy set when I am sort of convinced it could never have got
there in the first place.  Maybe something wierd for BoxLayout I did ??
